Key:
(Sorry, Kotori. I can't come to the phone
right now.)

(I don't know when Kurumi's going to
disappear. This moment is precious to me.)
All right.
Are you absolutely certain?
Don't worry. I'm sure it's nothing.
Shido-san...
It's okay. No one's getting in our way.
Are you sure? You really chose me?
Yes. You're mine. It has to be you, Kurumi.

(Kurumi feels so warm. Spirit, enemy...
Whatever category she once fell under
doesn't matter to me at all anymore.)

(Right now, I want to keep Kurumi safe.
She's fleeting. If no one else is on her side,
then I will be. I'll make her smile.)
Shido-san...

(So, my relationship with Kurumi changed.
We became a couple, if only for a brief time.)

(Since Kurumi is a clone, I know she'll
disappear in the near future.)

(But... all ordinary couples face this problem.
People don't choose how they fall in love, nor
do they choose when love is taken from them.)

(In our limited time together, we've formed a
deep bond. One that will help us overcome any
pain.)

(A race against time is one we cannot win, but
with Kurumi, anything is possible.)

(For now, I'll cling to the chance that I could
be wrong about everything...)

(I didn't want to let my happiness slip from
my fingers.)

Graduation day, huh? Never thought this day
would come.

(When I was a freshman, girls were the last
thing on my mind. People started rumors that
Tonomachi and I were an item. It was rough.)

(Then I became a sophomore and met Kurumi.
She was a terrifying Spirit, but before I knew it,
she burrowed herself into my heart.)

(Since then, Kurumi and I spent loads of time
together. All of a sudden, we were seniors, and
it was time for graduation.)
There you are, Shido-san.
Kurumi.

Just as I thought. I mean, this is our special
place.
Right.

(That's right. Kurumi hadn't disappeared yet.
Here she is, right beside me.)

(Back then, Kurumi thought if her body had
vanished, she would disappear too. But she's
still around.)

(Why Kurumi hadn't disappeared... I don't
know. I'm not sure anyone does.)

(Some mysteries remain, but I don't care.
The reason doesn't matter to me.)

(Was it a miracle? I'll take it. Kurumi's with
me now. That's all I need.)
What were you doing?
Thinking about you, Kurumi.
Same as always then, isn't it?
You're talking as if I obsess over you.
Oh. Was I mistaken?
Well, not entirely.
Goodness. Hehehe...
Hahaha.

Shido-san. I'm elated. More than you know.
But I'm also scared.
Hm? Hey, wait. Kurumi!

Today, we bid our uniforms farewell, right?
I wanted to bask in this moment with you.
S-Seriously?!
Yes. Shido-san, you seem happy as well.
Well, er...
My happiness is for you and you alone.
Oh, well... Okay.

(To tell you the truth, that was a lot to take
in, but I'm all the happier for it. Actually, it's
nice.)

(She may still disappear one day, but that
won't stop us from living our lives to the
fullest.)
(I won't regret savoring it.)
